laboratory_examinations.findings: Precontrast images showed an eccentric plaque with a large lipid core and a thin fibrous cap in the left internal carotid artery. USPIO-enhanced MRI revealed a focal area of signal reduction within the plaque.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: There was no clinical response despite the decrease of pristanate after plasma exchanges, and an increase in pristanate levels occurred after resuming dietary intake.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Unchanged with no cerebral infarction, showed high signal in the pons, basal ganglia, thalami, and cerebral peduncles.
Showed excess slow activity with superimposed sharp frontoparietal delta activity.
Bilateral delay, but pattern VERs were normal.
Normal P50 components but marked bilateral reduction in N95 components.

laboratory_examinations.date: After carotid endarterectomy, 48 hours post USPIO administration
laboratory_examinations.findings: Confirmed the presence of USPIO particles within plaque and identified macrophages.
